title: Travel Advisory for international Travellers to Pakistan gets a review
content:
ISLAMABAD, MAR 1 (APP): The Civil Aviation Authority of Pakistan has updated its travel advisory for international travelers to Pakistan from March 1 and modified the countries placed in Categories A, B, and C.
The travelers from Category A countries can travel to Pakistan and do not require a Covid19 PCR Test to enter the country.
Australia, Bhutan, China, Fiji, Japan, Kazakhstan, Laos, Mauritania, Mongolia, Morocco, Myanmar, Nepal, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Saudi Arabia, Sri Lanka, Singapore, Trinidad and Tobago,  Tajikistan and Vietnam.
All those countries not included in either Category A or C, will be in Category B and travelers from all these countries require a Covid19 PCR Test to enter the country.
Only those travelers from Category-C countries will be allowed to travel to Pakistan; who have a negative PCR Test Certification, conducted 72 hours prior to commencement of travel.
In addition, these passengers also need to be;
South Africa, Botswana, Ghana, Kenya, Comoros, Mozambique, Zambia, Tanzania, Brazil, Peru, Colombia, UK, Ireland, Portugal, and the Netherlands.
